verses.text: 那一夜，王睡不著覺，就吩咐人把史記，就是年鑒拿來，在王面前誦讀。

words.note: A common verbal phrase meaning 'unable to fall asleep'.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 有一處記著說：王有兩個守門的太監：辟探和提列，企圖要謀害亞哈隨魯王；這事給末底改告發了。
王問：「為了這事，末底改得了甚麼尊榮和封賜沒有？」侍候王的眾臣僕回答：「他甚麼也沒有得到。」

words.note: Used at the end of a sentence to form a yes/no question.
Used in negative sentences, meaning 'nothing' when combined with negation.

verses.text: 王問：「誰在院子裡？」那時哈曼正進了王宮的外院，要求王把末底改掛在哈曼為他預備的木架上。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 王的臣僕對他說：「是哈曼站在院子裡。」王說：「叫他進來。」
哈曼就進去，王問他：「王喜歡賜尊榮給他的人，要怎樣待他呢？」哈曼心裡想：「王喜歡賜尊榮的人，除我以外，還有誰呢？」

words.note: Verb with directional complement '去'.
A formal term for 'honor' or 'dignity'.
A formal term for 'honor' or 'dignity'.

verses.text: 於是哈曼回答王：「王喜歡賜尊榮的人，

words.note: A formal term for 'honor' or 'dignity'.

verses.text: 要把王常穿的朝服和王常騎的駿馬，就是頭戴王冠的駿馬帶來，

words.note: Introduces object of a verb to indicate its disposal/effect.
Refers to official attire worn at court.
Verb with directional complement '來'.

verses.text: 把朝服和駿馬交給王最尊貴的一個大臣手裡，把衣服給王喜歡賜尊榮的人穿上，使他騎在馬上，走過城中的街上，又要有人在他前面宣告：『王喜歡賜尊榮的人，要這樣待他。』」

words.note: Introduces object of a verb to indicate its disposal/effect.
Refers to official attire worn at court.
Introduces object of a verb to indicate its disposal/effect.
A formal term for 'honor' or 'dignity'.
Verb with directional complement '上'.
Can mean 'to send' or 'to enable'.
Literally 'horse upon'.
Verb with directional/aspect complement '過'.
A formal term for 'honor' or 'dignity'.

verses.text: 王對哈曼說：「趕快拿朝服和駿馬來，照著你所說的，去行在那坐在朝門那裡的猶大人末底改身上；你所說的，一樣也不可缺少。」

words.note: Refers to official attire worn at court.
Used as a directional complement to a verb.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb or verb phrase.
Refers to the Jewish people or a person from Judah.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 於是哈曼把朝服和駿馬拿來，先給末底改穿上朝服，然後使他騎在馬上，走過城中的街上，又在他前面宣告：「王喜歡賜尊榮的人，要這樣待他。」

words.note: Connects cause and effect or sequence.
Formal or literary term for 'give'.
Often used in religious or formal contexts.

verses.text: 末底改仍回到御門那裡；哈曼卻急急忙忙回了家，帶著悲哀的心蒙著頭。

words.note: Refers to the gate of the king's palace.
Reduplicated form emphasizes the hurried manner.
蒙 (méng) implies 'to cover' or 'to be covered'.

verses.text: 哈曼把遭遇的一切事，都述說給他的妻子細利斯和他所有的朋友聽；他的謀士和妻子細利斯對他說：「在末底改面前，你開始失敗了；他若是猶大人，你就不能勝過他：你終必在他面前失敗。」

words.note: More formal than just '說'.
Often used in historical or formal contexts.
More formal than '如果'.
Formal or literary, implying inevitability.

verses.text: 他們還與哈曼說話的時候，王的太監來了，催哈曼快走，赴以斯帖預備的筵席。

words.note: More formal than '跟' or '和'.
Historical term for a palace official.
More formal than '去' or '參加'.
Refers to a formal feast or banquet.
